frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Patient to be wet with a Liquid.
A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.
A Landmark (in combination with the image schema evoked by particular targets) serves to pick out the final location of a Trajector in a construed or actual motion event.
This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone acts to prevent a Fire_disaster from occurring, accelerating, or affecting any area not identified as a Controlled_area.
An Entity is designed for or exists to perform an Activity or fulfill a Role. '' 'This platform will serve as a great stage for tomorrow's play.'
An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.
frameExamples: Samantha stalwartly <t>defended</t> the gateway from the wraiths, crouching low over Stephen's prone form.
Flights <t>into</t> Denver are not permitted at this time.
This platform will <t>serve</t> as a great stage for tomorrow's play.
As it turns out, putting all of my eggs in one basket completely <t>solved</t> all of my problems.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become wet.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates or covers the <fen>Patient</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
The <fen>Patient</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores or has the <fen>Liquid</fen> covering its surface.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of wetness.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The individual or entity that is under attack from the <fen>Assailant</fen> .
This role identifies the time when the Defender takes forceful action against the Assailant.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Defender</fen> defends the <fen>Victim</fen> from the <fen>Assailant</fen>.
The relatively locatable entity which serves as a basis for determining the location of the <fen>Trajector</fen> using the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.
The location (located with respect to the <fen>Landmark</fen>) which is profiled by the particular image schema pertaining to the locative relation.
The entity which is construed to be in motion, whose location at the end of the construed motion event is in question.
The time at which the <fen>Trajector</fen> is located in the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.
The fire that Firefighters target.
The individual or group who respond(s) to the <fen>Fire</fen>.
The time when the Firefighter fights the Fire.
This role identifies the location of the Firefighters as they attempt to fight the Fire.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is an object or person that performs the <fen>Activity</fen> or fulfills the <fen>Role</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> is the action that the <fen>Entity</fen> performs.
The <fen>Role</fen> is  the position or duty that is occupied by the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or <fen>Problem</fen>.
The <fen>Problem</fen> is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the <fen>Problem</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
This role indicates the location at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Hannah</fex> drenched the cat with anti-flea ointment.
If <fex>we</fex> have not been able to resolve a problem to your satisfaction, please email us.
Likewise, once the students worked through <fex>the problem</fex> and obtained their results, their next assignment would be to publish these to the web.
First, <fex>the Tripartite Agreement of 1979</fex> actually solved the only significant friction between the two countries.
A group of international scientists solved the fundamental particle hierarchy question <fex>at an underground accelerator</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Avon Fire and Rescue Service
